lead_paragraph: Mr. Badreddine, 55, had been accused in the 2005 assassination of a former prime minister of Lebanon, and many other attacks.

byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, and Sewell Chan from London. James Glanz contributed reporting from Jerusalem, Hwaida Saad from Beirut, and Rick Gladstone from New York.
byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and SEWELL CHAN

headline.print_headline: Senior Hezbollah Commander Is Killed in Syria, and the Suspects Are Many
headline.main: Mustafa Badreddine, Hezbollah Military Commander, Is Killed in Syria

snippet: Mr. Badreddine, 55, had been accused in the 2005 assassination of a former prime minister of Lebanon, and many other attacks.
abstract: Death of top Hezbollah military commander Mustafa Amine Badreddine in explosion in Beirut is considered militant group's biggest loss in years and raises questions over its future and role in Syria war; among most pressing questions is who was responsible for attack, with suspects including Israel, Saudi Arabia and range of militant groups opposed to Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad.
